description: Conversion of the first floor flat into two self contained flats (1 x studio, and 1 x 2 bed), a part two storey/part first floor rear extension (incorporating a Juliet balcony at first floor level); alterations to the roof of the existing two storey outrigger; dormer window extension to the rear roof slope (involving the conversion of the roofspace to habitable use; installation of an additional access to the flats to the rear at ground floor and provision of refuse and cycle storage.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) A8024/ P01, P02, P03, P04 received 9th March 2012 and A8024/ P05 Rev. C, P06 Rev C, P07 Rev. C, P08 Rev. D and P09 received 20th May 2012,  unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the property and the area as a whole in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5  of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5  of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of insulation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for the floor/ceiling between residential units and any walls separating the commercial part of the premises from the residential accommodation hereby approved, before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that they are resistant to the passage of smoke, fumes and odours and that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the premises and shall thereafter be permanently retained.  Reason: To prevent noise disturbance in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed developmentin accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011  policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'  and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details for mitigation works to protect habitable rooms from external noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The criteria to be met and the assessment method used shall be that specified at Ealing's Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and Ealing Pollution Control's Document 5.3 'Guidance for Developers'. The mitigation works shall also take into account the ventilation strategy for the building approved in accordance with Condition 7 of this permission.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  Reason:  To protect occupiers of the building from noise as the development will be affected by significant  traffic/ aircraft noise noise, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 nad 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of a ventilation strategy setting out measures for providing fresh air ventilation from the rear of the building to habitable rooms facing Broadway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure suitable measures are installed to protect residents from air pollution, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4,  7.6, and 7.14  of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 3: 'Air Quality'. | Details of compliance of the residential units hereby approved with Lifetime Homes standards shall be submitted to the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development, unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the development provides access for all future occupiers and meets Lifetime Homes Standards in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework,  policy 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | The refuse and recycling storage  hereby permitted shall be formed and made available for use before the firts occupation of the residnetial units and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework and policies 2.10 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A total of 2 secure, lockable and covered cycle parking spaces shall be provided on the site prior to the first use of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with the policy 9.6 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policy 6.9 of The London Plan (2011). | Prior to the commencement of the development on the site, details of a site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:+ 	 -on-site construction worker parking. -anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site. -delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods)+ -site security -vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access and exit from the site -details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris. procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.    Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites, to ensure adequate highway and site safety and to prevent damage to surrounding buildings and structures, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004, policies 7.4-7.5, and 7.21 of The London Plan (2011). | Details of screening for the first floor terrace shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the development hereby approved. The screening shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the development hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5  of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
